titleStmt.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to George L. Rives, April 2, 1888

bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to George L. Rives
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia, Liberia, April 2nd 1888.
Mr B. Y. Payne, to the Assistant Secretary of State.
Quarterly returns from the Consulate Agency at Elimina Gold Coast Colony.

I have the honor respectfully to forward you the quarterly returns for the quarter ended September 30th 1887, and December 31st 1887. of the Consular Agency at Elmina, Gold Coast, Colony. Please find enclosures enclosures
enclosures as follows
Two Arrivals and Departures of vessels #1 Two Detailed Report of official service #2. Two Summary of business #3. (One) Digest of Invoice book #4. (One) Return of Trade with the United States #5
I regret exceedingly that I have not transmitted these returns before now, my reason for not doing so, was as stated in my No 7. (the delusive instruction of Mr Taylor.)

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obedient Servant
Beverly Y. Payne.
div1.fw:
Hon.,
George L. Rives
Ass't Sec'y of State
